> I am a JUNit newbie - does anyone perhaps know if what the 
> de-facto st=
andard approach is to data-driven JUnit testing 
> (if something like that =
exists).
> 
> Is it even relevant as far as unit testing is concerned?

It =
is totally relevant.  A few weeks (maybe months) after you start
using JUni=
t seriously, you'll realize you need to use data driven test
design to elim=
inate duplication of test code.  When we got to that
point, we wrote some h=
andy-dandy Java utility code to make it easy to
extract rows of data from a=
n Excel spreadsheet.  Then we can cycle
through a single JUnit test 300 tim=
es with different data.  We've found
it's often easier to understand the te=
st data if it's in a tabular
format (a spreadsheet) than if it's written di=
rectly into the Java code.


Todd.
